Reviews.Title: “hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Angie L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. The staff was friendly and the room was extremely clean. The beds were comfortable and I have no complaints. It is located downtown next to shopping, sight-seeing and restaurants. I gaurantee you will be satisfied with your stay. I would definitely stay at Comfort Suites City Centre next time I am in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Tizzy_5352
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights for an exhibition at the Indiana Convention Center. From the time I checked in late at night I have enjoyed my stay. Breakfast is included in the tariff and consists a basic range of the typical american breakfast with a continental twist. The front office manager - Wanda was very helpful with issues I had with a delayed suitcase and other packages arriving. There is a complimentary business center with a printer that works for a change. There is free high speed wireless in the room. The room was huge and very comfortable. Right across the road from Lucas Oil stadium and an easy 5 min walk to the back door of the Convention Center. You can get a drink and good basic food in the restaurant in the evening. As a business traveler this ticked all the boxes for me. Oh I forgot the air conditioning was the noisiest I have come across. Solved that problem easy. I turned it off and reported it.

Reviews.Title: “I found a new Indianapolis hotel to call home”
Reviews.Author: YourNextGuest
Reviews.Content: I will be travelling to Indy a lot in the coming months. This hotel is where I'll be staying. It is clean, and the staff is excellent. The breakfast is good and has a lot of items to choose from. The style of the property is great. I have no complaints and I'm going to book for my next trip today.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Mrspsop
Reviews.Content: We used our rewards points for a weekend getaway. Beautiful spacious room. Kids loved the pool. Great breakfast! Right across from Lucas Oil Stadium. Convenient parking . GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent mid-range hotel, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: travelguydc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in December. Was generally quite pleased with the experience, would stay here again. Building was new and spotless; standard king-bed room was spacious and well laid out; bathroom was immaculate (granite counter, decent no-name toiletries, excellent water pressure). Fitness center was spacious and had big windows -- not off in the basement somewhere -- and they had a indoor pool, which doesn't seem customary in this price range. (Self) parking in the adjacent garage was $12, which seemed about half the price of the parking fees at most downtown hotels. Free wireless in rooms, and they also had a business center off the lobby. Staff was friendly and helpful. I didn't try the comp breakfast. Location is good. It's directly adjacent to Lucas Oil Stadium. It's about a five block walk to the center of downtown Indianapolis. There are other hotels that are more centrally located, but those are either a lot pricier or are older, dated properties that have hidden fees (eg higher parking or Internet) that push the price up. I didn't mind walking the five blocks, but if you want to be right atop Monument Circle, this isn't the place. The one downside is that the sound insulation in this new hotel is not great. I was there four nights. Two nights things were utterly silent. A third night I actually heard my neighbors' voices in the adjacent room -- couldn't make out the words, but could definitely tell when their conversation would begin and end (and they weren't yelling). The fourth night was New Years, so the overall noise level was understandably high, but every time a door closed on the floor it echoed through my room. All in all, this wasn't a huge problem for me, but it was definitely some of the worst sound insulation I've ever encountered in a hotel, so if you're especially sensitive to that, I'd factor it into your planning. Which is a shame, because the staff here does such a great job -- but remedying lousy construction standards isn't part of their job. Again, for me, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything you would look for in a mid-range hotel.”
Reviews.Author: winslow82
Reviews.Content: Came in and stayed for the Big Ten Championship Football Game and we enjoyed a fantastic time here, and in town. (Of course the fact that the Badgers won helped out quite a bit too) Very clean, very nice hotel, it is a quite new property with pretty much every thing you could need. If they don't have it here, you are located a very pleasant walk from Lucas Stadium, and the downtown area that is loaded with restraunts and other attractions. The staff was extremely pleasant and take customer service very seriously. This will be our home base when we are in Indianapolis for years to come. Would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: Rob C
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a terrific stay at this Comfort Suites. The staff were very helpful and outgoing with an aim to please. Recently built property with spacious rooms, comfortable beds and great water pressure in the shower. Bar area is nice and food was very good. It is also a stones throw from Lucas Oil Stadium and a short walk to the downtown area. Overall a very good experience while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Always My # 1 Choice”
Reviews.Author: Krystle C
Reviews.Content: Took my children to the Indianapolis Children's museum had a great time. Went to the hotel afters to have a even great time at the hotel. My children swam in the pool while mommy n daddy workout. The hotel absolutely beautiful & also very clean. The staff was great Wanda the manager was amazing very polite & helpful. Had a little problem with the noise coming from another room but Wanda fix that right up for me. Can't wait to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and big rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Lukekypr
Reviews.Content: Very nice, modern, recently - 3yrs ago built. Bigger than usual rooms, comfortable beds, super close to both stadiums.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Momof2gurls
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel!! They are a little out of the city center but fun and relaxed. I loved it. Had such a fun time with me and the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable beds, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MarkE49007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two sons to attend GenCon at the Indiana Convention Center. This hotel is about a 7 minute walk to the ICC. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean and well made when we returned each evening. Breakfast was crowded, but the staff worked hard to keep the hot food in stock. The first morning we had as hot choices: eggs in one server and Biscuits/Gravy in the other. But the other mornings it was eggs in one server and eggs/with ham pieces added in the other. Would've appreciated a bit more choice. The milk was always good and cold for the cereal. Rooms were quiet, except sometimes a little noisy from traffic. Would definitely stay here again because of convenience to the Convention Center, free breakfast, good beds and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Indy.”
Reviews.Author: west2926
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty nice hotel (fairly new) near the heart of downtown Indianapolis. It was nice to be able to stay downtown without costing a small fortune. So many things right around the corner: Lucas Oil Stadium, Vicotry Field, most museums, etc. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great staff, right next to stadium”
Reviews.Author: Dad05
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute bc I was in Indy and wanted a hotel with 2 Queen beds. It is fairly new and very clean. FYI: parking is $12 night. The hotel was booked up......but the staff was very friendly and accomodating. I lost my parking pass for the garage and they cheerfully made me another one. Not much in the way of restaurants close by (say walking distance)....but it's not far to the dwtn restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: wiseconstr05
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a family emergency at a downtown hospital and we needed a place to stay. We had stayed at a Comfort Suites before so we tried this one. We didn,t have any reservations, but the staff said they were slow so they gave us a deal on the room. When the lobby attendent realized our situation ( 4 adults and 2 babies) she upgraded us to a bigger room at no charge. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lacks personal attention to cusotmer needs”
Reviews.Author: cbMoline
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine, Breakfast was good, but there are a couple of things that need to be brought to your attention. When the Kleenex box was empty in my room after just one tissue, I phoned and asked for another (this should have been checked by maid when cleaning the room before my arrival) they told me they were out and they had a truck coming in the morning. I just commented that that would not be of any help to me then. Also, when using the one remaining tissue from the box, the holder which had been pushed back into the corner of the Bathroom counter, I found a used Kleenex behind the container. That tells me something about how the maid cleaned the room and had me questioning how good a job was done on the rest of the room. I think this was a poor response to me as a customer. My thoughts: why would there have been a shortage in the first place?, and two, were all the rooms filled in the whole hotel that they couldn't have gone to an unused room and pulled the Kleenex box out for my room? I know this probably sounds trivial, but I didn't appreciate the answer, or the idea my room was not clean. You also need to know the TV stations were not always what was on the list in the room, and just going through the channels with the remote they didn't go in sequence, and several stations had poor color.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was a great hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Dawns206
Reviews.Content: My first impression was what a beautiful hotel this is and how very nice and helpful the staff is. I still think this. The beds are so comfortable, however in the middle of the night my husband woke to something crawling on him. We turned on the lights and sure enough bed bugs. My husband is in pest control so he knew immediately . We took the bed apart and there was more evidence, so we had our rooms switched and no more problems. We were told that it was the first time, however now I see another review that mentioned it. We checked my daughter and son in law's bed in the morning and even though they didn't have bugs currently, my husband could see the traces that showed there had been. The hotel handled this, but when they were supposed to call hotwire to let them know, they didn't plus had no record, so I had to call the manager and find out what was going on. They comped the rooms so I appreciate the great service, but not the lie about there never being bed bugs before or the fact that the manager didn't call hotwire to take care of this. It is a beautiful hotel, great location and great staff, but be aware and check the bed when you get into a room. I'm going to say yes to recommendation, but with a warning.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about the hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: lashworth2009
Reviews.Content: All of the employees were very pleasant and helpful. The manager was GREAT! I have already recommended this hotel to friends and family. Our stay was very enjoyable. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crimmps49
Reviews.Content: We were early, but the hotel only had us wait a short while as the room was being prepared. The rooms are very big with a nice lounging area. Great set up for WIFI and computer work. The beds were very comfortable and I really would like one of the pillows at home here! The staff were all so friendly and helpful all over the hotel, including the desk, restaurant and cleaning staff. We definitely would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs raided my room”
Reviews.Author: vonceal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the Comfort Suites City Center, 515 South West Street, Indianapolis, IN Thrusday, Sept 30. When we went into the room our first impression was good. I used one of their towels to wipe the draws out then I unpacked our luggage. We went out to eat came back went to bed. We got up the following morning (Friday) got ourselves ready to leave the room, I picked my purse up off the table that sits in between the beds with the lamp, clock and phone on it. I notice a small bug on my purse. I tried to prevent the bug from going into my purse but the little bug moved so quickly my eyes could not follow it. My purse was black and the table was also dark in color. I empted the content of my purse on the bed to make sure the bug was not in my purse. I could not find the bug ,so I put everthing back in my purse and my husband and I left for breakfast and to spend the day with my cousin. We was gone all day. We returned to the hotel it had been a long day so we went to bed. The following morning (Saturday) I woke up with a red spot on my right upper arm by now I am a little concern that maybe there are bed bugs in our room. I went to the bathroom to check my body for other spots, but I did not see any other spots so I was relieved. I checked the beds but I did not see anything. Saturday night after the Circle City Classic game was over we purchased food and headed back to our room. We sat around talked and watched TNT. I turned the lamp on that sat on the table in between the beds. I was sitting on the side of the bed watching TV. My pop was on the table and I reached for the pop and these little bugs was running all over the white brochure and around the top of the table. I put my glases on and the bugs was also on the headboard and the wall that the head board was attached on. My husband and I killed a few of them but they kept coming. We call the front desk , The desk clerk an older white lady came up to investigate. She saw the bugs, and change us from room 211 to room 210. Sunday morning when we went to check out the night desk clerk was no longer there, and according to the day desk clerk and manager on duty Sunday morning the night clerk that gave us the key cards and brought up the cart for us to move from room 211 to room 210 wrote she saw one bug. The manager gave my husband a card and told him to call the General Manager Richard Letko. I showed the night desk clerk the bugs, she saw the bugs with her own eyes. The fact that they lied about their bug problem in the room I stayed in made me believe they knew about the bugs. I do not believe my husband and I are the first to report it. I am not sure if these bugs just come out at night or if I just did not notice them because the wood was dark and maybe because I was gone most of the day. bugs was also on the desk, but nothing like on the table in between the two beds. My family and I have dealt with this hotel chain for years, and this is the first time I have encounter bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Lucas Oil stadium is right out the back door and downtown is 10 minute walk.”
Reviews.Author: Islandehopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a football game. The location could not have been better. Fans gather here for pre game eats and then across the street to the stadium. Zoo, park and downtown are all with in short walk. The pool and hot tub were clean and convenient. Only problem was one elevator broke leaving only one operational for the stay which made for long waits. Bus from airport ($7) drops you and picks up right across the street from the hotels enterance.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: AHandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. If your looking for a great downtown Indy location...especially for a Colts game this is the place to be. They have a great breakfast and relaxing pool. Great for families!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: cheezhdinoh
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Easy to get there from I-70. 1 block to Lucas Oil Field. Just a couple of blocks (you could walk if you wanted) from Meridian, which is where the nightlife is. About 6 miles from the speedway. Parking in structure was right out the lobby doors and secure and although it is an addl $10 it was no big deal. Everything was clean, from the lobby to the room. Friendly staff. Included breakfast was a plus! Can't rate pool or whirlpool since never made it there. The only issue I had was with the pillows in the room...too soft, so you might want to bring your own. Overall, VERY impressed. Will definitely book here next time in Indy!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: bossfan59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on way back from Bloomington and was extremely pleased with all aspects of the stay. It lived up to the reviews! It was a great value (booked through discount travel website). Check in was quick, friendly and simple. Parking was in an adjacent garage; $10/night. Room was spacious and very clean with king size bed, full size couch, desk and chair, flat panel TV. Bathroom was a good size with great water pressure. Bed was very comfortable, air conditioning worked well and elevators were very fast. The maids were very pleasant and said Good Morning in the hallway which is not often the case, in my experience. The hot tub was open to 11 a.m. which was nice for a relaxing dip after dinner. Only downside (and a very minor one) is the location which is not within close walking distance to downtown. Very convenient to get to from the highway, however, which more than makes up for that (Indy is easy to drive in anyway). Will skip a stay in Bloomington next time I visit Indiana University and stay here instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vikyrodri_07
Reviews.Content: It's nice clean and like brand new! Best hotel I've stayed at here in Indianapolis! I had no problems with my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, friendly staff, walking distance to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: jmcfarland76
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel via a certain discount website! Our room was clean and spacious (we were put in a handicap room), staff was friendly, pool was nice, beds were comfy. Our view was of Lucas Oil Stadium just across the street. It was a short distance to downtown and museums. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: off2wdw4fun
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for the Indianapolis 500 weekend and spent $250 per night for our room. The first time we used the toilet paper holder, it fell apart. An easyfix with a small screw driver. Yet, despite 7 interactions with the staff and even a visit to their maintenance room to look for a screwdriver to fix it myself, it still has not been fixed as they did not have a screwdriver small enough and apparently are not willing to purchase one. The entire situation should have been quickly resolved. Their lack of attention to detail in getting this fixed is very unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel with Restaurant and Bar Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaFamilyguy007
Reviews.Content: This hotels exceeded our expectations. It has a great location and the restaurant and bar may be small but very quaint. The staff was terrific helped with directions and made your feel right at home. I am really pleased with this Comfort Suites. I would recommend this hotel over many others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “planning ahead with reservations and confirmations DO NOT matter !!”
Reviews.Author: sledjockey
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for 2 rooms for over 3 months. When we arrived they only had 1 room for us. When we showed the mngr our confirmation he said gee sorry, I can give you 1 room with 2 king beds and a pull out, FOR 8 PEOPLE. Since nobody will return phone calls or e-mails, with an explaination as to what happened, one can only assume they were greedy on a busy weekend and wanted to get more for at least 1 of our rooms. Its too bad, it looked like a nice place, and probably is, just very poor managment. BEWARE !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Colts game”
Reviews.Author: kandvr
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now. Everything about this hotel is very good. You are just across the street for Lucas Oil Stadium. And only a couple blocks from all the action downtown. The rooms are very nice and clean and big. Especially if you can get a good deal on them. Well worth it. If you're going for the game, the parking is only $10 a night. But beware, they will charge you another $30 for parking for the game. The 2 bedroom suites are nice, but the divider only sticks out maybe 2 feet, so there is not a lot of privacy, if you're with other people. Haven't done the breakfast yet, usually go to Steak n Shake before the game. Bed and shower are excellent though. All in all, great location and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, big room”
Reviews.Author: Nathanka
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay here....room was huge, bed was comfy and in general the stay was pleasant. Aesthetically, the area around the hotel isn't that nice, but the gas station across the street does provide access to beverages and snacks when needed. As another noted the property is on the "other" side of the stadium and convention center, but it is hardly a strenuous walk to restaurants and such that are downtown (there ain't much in this city, so don't get your hopes up about "downtown."). And yes, there is a very strong "fried" smell when you walk into the lobby...it's like you're at the county fair or something. But I didn't notice this outside of the lobby. Staff was nice, rooms were clean...couldn't have been happier for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Expo 2009”
Reviews.Author: jmvon
Reviews.Content: After a last a minute decision, my boyfriend and I decided to go to Indianapolis for the weekend to catch the concerts at the Expo. To our surprise we were able to get a room at a responsible price. The front desk staff, Wanda, was extremely helpful with guiding us to the local activities. The room was spacious, clean and a great deal. We Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with Lucas Oil Stadium right outside the back door”
Reviews.Author: letsgohere
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as a short getaway to Indianapolis. One of the things we were looking forward to doing during our visit was a tour of the Colts' Lucas Oil Stadium. As far as location goes, this hotel is the perfect place to stay if you're wanting to do that or are going for a Colts game. On the other hand, this hotel is just a short drive from the Indianapolis Zoo, canal walk, and downtown shopping and sightseeing, but might not be ideal if you're wanting to walk to those places. They aren't as close as they appear on maps, and local construction and busy streets made walking not as safe. Besides the stadium, two other hotels and a gas station across the street, there isn't really anything else within a few blocks. During the stay, you can either park in a parking garage adjacent to the hotel or in a small parking lot behind the hotel if there's room. There was room for us to park in the lot, but they still automatically added $10/day to our bill for parking, which I thought was odd... The room was nice with trendy furnishings, but nothing spectacular. We were able to enjoy both the whirlpool and the heated swimming pool. The gym also looked nice, but we didn't use it during our stay. I loved how the front lobby area was decorated and enjoyed sitting there in the morning to watch the news on TV. There also are three computers in the lobby that are free to use and had super-fast internet. The hotel provides a free, but basic continental breakfast with one hot "special" of the day (scrambled eggs w/ diced ham one morning and bacon and hard-boiled eggs the next), and also served bagels, toast, cereal, danishes, fruit and juice, milk and coffee. The hotel also has a cafe/bar area where you can order meals and drinks and I noticed a lot of other people eating/drinking there. Overall, we were satisfied with this hotel and would probably stay there again when visiting Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Town!”
Reviews.Author: leighleigh9
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, wonderful amenities and the staff was just great! It's a decently priced hotel within walking distance of Lucas Oil Stadium and everything downtown. LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay @ the Comfort Suites City Centre”
Reviews.Author: K11G
Reviews.Content: My friends and I always make our way to downtown Indianapolis for the Indy Tree Lighting the day after Thaksgiving and got the opportunity to stay at the Comfort Suites City Centre & it was only a few blocks from downtown...a great location! From the moment we walked in the door to the second we left, the staff was absolutely fabulous and the hotel was so gorgeous and very clean! Our room overlooked the new Lucas Oil Stadium, which was a great view, and everything about our room exceeded our expectations! Thanks to everyone at Comfort Suites City Centre and I highly recommend staying at this fabulous hotel in Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: Dar10ac
Reviews.Content: Agent booked me here. She's getting a thank you note. New hotel, right next to my other favorite the Staybridge. Compared to other Comfort Suites I've stayed with before this was great! They had a bar and restaurant which I've never seen in any Comfort before. The lobby and rooms all seemed very modern and colorful the red hallways are way cool. My room was great- it was clean and the flat screen tv was nice. The free internet was also a great bonus. Front desk girl, Wanda, was helpful, gave us directions and a map for a great seafood restaurant, Oceanaire. Didn't get a chance to visit the breakfast, bummer. I would suggest to anyone staying here, ask for a room with a view of the Lucas Oil Stadium! This is my second time in Indy. So far i'm very impressed. Everything seems clean and downtown has lots to offer. The mall was close by too, didn't get a chance to go this time.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for Business”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravelMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Suites for one night only during a business trip. The hotel is very clean and all staff I came in contact with were extremely pleasant and helpful. The room was clean, the bed comfortable. We had lunch on the outdoor patio off the dining room area. Food was ok. There is an odd, rather strong odor when first walking into the hotel, I suspect from the kitchen although it doesn't smell in the hallways or in the room. The basic complimentary breakfast was welcomed and good. The soap and shampoo provided are not particularly special. The business center in the lobby was really helpful so my co-workers and I were happy to have that accessible. The only downside here is that the hotel is on the opposite side of the Lucas Oil Stadium so not an easy walk to all the restaurants downtown.
